# canBecomeFirstResponder

**Instance Property**

Returns a Boolean value indicating whether this object can become the first responder.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var canBecomeFirstResponder: Bool { get }
```

## Return Value

[doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] if the responder can become the first responder; otherwise, [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false].

## Discussion

This method returns [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false] by default. Subclasses must override this method and return [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] to be able to become first responder.

Don’t call this method on a view that’s not currently in the active view hierarchy. The result is undefined.

## Managing the responder chain

- **next**: Returns the next responder in the responder chain, or `nil` if there’s no next responder.
- **isFirstResponder**: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether this object is the first responder.
- **becomeFirstResponder()**: Asks UIKit to make this object the first responder in its window.
- **canResignFirstResponder**: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the responder is willing to relinquish first-responder status.
- **resignFirstResponder()**: Notifies this object that it has been asked to relinquish its status as first responder in its window.
